snippet: The prosecutor’s office said in a statement that the men — all former members of the Bosnian Serb special police — were charged with taking part in the killings of about 1,300 people.
abstract: Eight former Bosnian Serb special policemen are charged by war crimes court with helping slaughter 1,300 people in Kravica, village outside Srebrenica, site of 1995 massacre where about 8,000 Muslims were killed; such prosecutions are condition for Serbia's entry into European Union.
lead_paragraph: The prosecutor’s office said in a statement that the men — all former members of the Bosnian Serb special police — were charged with taking part in the killings of about 1,300 people.

headline.main: Serbia: Eight Former Officers Charged in 1995 Massacre Near Srebrenica
headline.print_headline: Europe; Serbia: Eight Former Officers Charged in 1995 Massacre Near Srebrenica

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

keywords.value: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
